 In the end, I get the impression that you're young and full of it. You seem to have no idea what the gay community was like in the 1980's and prior to that. Where there is more acceptance now, there wasn't then.
 It's called slow change.
 
 I have no problems championing a reasonable and rational cause. But, get all terroristic and I'd just simply shoot you myself rather than be bothered or annoyed. Target me as collateral in your crusade and you loose more allies than you'd gain.
 
 So, you want moderates to come to your side?
 Be nice and calm. I heard a nice NPR radio segment on Sunday about this where the key speaker (gay) rationally pointed out the issues and his desires and defused concerns.
 Be irrational and you won't get much support at all. Except by fellow radicals...the ones who would rather be a martyr for selfish reasons rather than an unsung hero for the good of all your kind.
 
 This is all about PR.

 
 So then you would agree that I do not have to accept heterosexual marriages? That if I own a busisness I do not have to, or be forced to accept my employees mmarriages? That if I own a business and my employes religious views differ and are opposed to mine that I have the right to terminate them? That I as a gay man have the right to discriminate and oppress heterosexuals?
Zardoz

So then you would agree that I do not have to accept heterosexual marriages? That if I own a busisness I do not have to, or be forced to accept my employees mmarriages? That if I own a business and my employes religious views differ and are opposed to mine that I have the right to terminate them? That I as a gay man have the right to discriminate and oppress heterosexuals?

 
 
 Speaking from ONLY my personal experience on this, I have seen far more homosexuals be discriminatory towards heteros. Ranging from kiosks in the local mall run by gays and only hiring gays to A homosexual mgmt at a Wendy's restaurant years ago that promoted gays over heteros.
 
 This is NOT how most of the world is and I'm sure the reverse is also true for some.
 
 As to your points, NO, you do not have to recognize the marriages of others unless forced to do so. But, you may find it political to do so.
 As for hirings and firings, same but there are often laws to prevent that. Just as laws are being introduced to protect your kinds also. Laws against ANY type of discrimination didn't just pop up over night. It took hard WORK and PATIENCE to get the masses or judges to agree with them using tools of persuasion and a sound logic to get others to listen to your pleas.
 Ranting about the unfairness of the situation you find yourself in isn't going to CHANGE it. Might as well scream to the uncaring sky god for all the good it's going to do you.
 
 What I'm saying is you're not in a good position to enact your will upon the majority without suffering a massive defeat. Not only for yourself but for those who would ally with you. Be them fellow gays or those sympathetic to your plight. You're being counter productive. Personally, in the byzantine world, if you didn't take sound advice and chill, I'd remove you as an embarrasement to the 'casue'.
 
 So, you can discriminate all you want. But there could be consequences. The chances of you oppressing anyone is slim.
 I'm suggesting you change your strategy as your tactics are counter productive. I can understand your emotional painms at being denied fair treatment but think of all those who would say 'You haven't conviunced me and if this is how all gays act, I don't think I'll give an inch as you'll take a mile...I'm voting against you out of spite...so Nyaahh'
Bradamante

Proud of having those bed-fellows?

 
 Nice of you too to speculate based on some god-given psychic power to see me for who I really am ROFL
 
 However it still doesn't take away from the OP which seems only concerned with anti-democratic RELIGIOUS groups.
Matthew S

So you're against groups of people who seek democratic change?

 
 The point is that there should be certain things that are off limits to vote upon. If you open the door to voting upon some aspects of other peoples lives then you open the door to other people voting upon aspects of your life. What they do not understand that today it is marriage on the ballot but tommorrow it might just their religious freedom.
 
 
 

 No you make the misake. Anti-gay groups aren't all religious. Nazi groups think gays are un-natural. So you're only against what you perceive to be anti-democratic groups as long as their religious. So the problem for you is not that they're anti-demcratic - and you've not even proven that, but that they're religious

 
 Nazi groups do not have millions of members and are not whipping those members up into a religious frenzy. Nazi groups are not trying to impose their beliefs upon gay people. I don't have a problem with religious groups in general. I have a major problem with religious groups that are forcing their evil religious beliefs upon me and my life. I have a problem with any religious group that trys to deny my religious freedom. I believe that God sanctions and blesses samesex marriage so when these groups, who do not, put these measures on the ballot, claiming that gay marriage is against their religious beliefs, and my life is the life that is effected by such laws, then my religious freedom is being attacked and denied by these groups.
Zardoz

Nazi groups do not have millions of members and are not whipping those members up into a religious frenzy. Nazi groups are not trying to impose their beliefs upon gay people. I don't have a problem with religious groups in general. I have a major problem with religious groups that are forcing their evil religious beliefs upon me and my life. I have a problem with any religious group that trys to deny my religious freedom. I believe that God sanctions and blesses samesex marriage so when these groups, who do not, put these measures on the ballot, claiming that gay marriage is against their religious beliefs, and my life is the life that is effected by such laws, then my religious freedom is being attacked and denied by these groups.

 
 Maybe you should form a religion for gays only where all members have to be married to each other...then push for the issue on religious freedoms rights.
 ;)
Bradamante

No, we're against groups that promote theocracy.
 

 But not against Nazis
 

 Nazis still consider themselves Christians, so we're against all the radical religious groups that promote intolerance, oppression, opposition to equal rights, etc.

 There's no connection between the teachings of Christ and Nazi teaching.
Matthew S

But not against Nazis
 
 There's no connection between the teachings of Christ and Nazi teaching.

 
 True but there is a connection between those that say they are followers of christ and nazi teachings.
 
 "Lord Jesus please save me from your followers"
